intro: Prunella scaberrima, commonly known as rough blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Prunella scaberrima is often found in disturbed habitats and is considered a relatively uncommon species in its native range.
